definitions.definition: a plant grown for its grain that is used to produce the flour for bread, cakes, pasta, etc.; the grain of this plant
to recognize the difference between useful or valuable people or things and those that are not useful or have no value

examples.text: We sifted through the application forms to separate the wheat from the chaff.

wordOrigin: Old English hwǣte of Germanic origin; related to Dutch weit, German Weizen, also to white.
